item.title: Stories of past Travel Assistance Recipients
item.description: Stories of past Travel Assistance Recipients ¶ By Project Area By Background The Travel Assistance Committee helps those who would like to attend ApacheCon events, but are unable to do so for financial reasons. Over the years, TAC has helped many people, from all backgrounds and from all over the world, attend Apache events. This is a collection of some of their stories. By Project Area ¶ Interested in how people from projects in a certain area found TAC and ApacheCon?

item.title: Travel Assistance Committee - TAC
item.description: Travel Assistance Committee Stories Stories from previous successful applicants Stories coming soon!

item.title: Travel Assistance Committee - TAC
item.description: Travel Assistance Committee ¶ Events currently being supported by TAC ¶ Currently supported events ¶ Community Over Code Asia 2023 ¶ Applications are now being accepted to attend Community Over Code Asia 2023, which is taking place in Beijing, China between the 18th and 20th of August. Event details can be found on the Community-over-Code site or on the event ticketing website. The ASF Travel Assistance Committee hopes to offer 5 or 6 Conference Passes along with Hotel and Travel assistance as needed.

item.title: Travel Assistance Committee - TAC
item.description: Travel Assistance Committee - TAC ¶ Purpose and intended audience Application criteria What the assistance covers Arrangements and planning for successful applicants How to apply for travel assistance Events for which support is available Stories from past TAC recipients Who are TAC? Past Events The Travel Assistance Committee helps those who would like to attend ApacheCon events, but are unable to do so for financial reasons. Purpose and intended audience ¶ The Travel Assistance committee was reformed in September 2008 with the goal of providing financial assistance to those who would otherwise be unable to attend various ApacheCon events.
